poem:
Title: The Pilfered Deity

In Kathmandu, Adhikari woke
To startling news like an unholy yoke.
"Our gods, in gilded lockets of the West,
transplanted from their sacred, Himalayan nest."
Adhikari rallied - through night's cloak,
In pursuit of gods his people invoke.
"Return them home," his heart's anthem rings,
"To Nepal, realm of ancient kings."
